Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TAP 20N (Tracheal antimicrobial peptide S20N variant, beta defensin;  UCSS1a; 3S=S, natural AMPs; cattle, ruminant, mammals; animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against M. haemolytica, H. somni, P. multocida (Gram+ and viruses are not evaluated).This natural NAP variant is more active than the original form (AP235). Since there is only one residue change, it is predicted to have a beta structure as well. UPdated 6/2016.
Literature Information.Author: Taha-Abdelaziz K, Perez-Casal J, Schott C, Hsiao J, Attah-Poku S, Slavi? D, Caswell JL.2013
Literature Information.Title: Bactericidal activity of tracheal antimicrobial peptide against respiratory pathogens of cattle.
